title: Changes to daylight saving time have been hard. What does Trump think?
shortDescription: Donald Trump has previously supported making daylight saving time permanent, but also called it a “50-50 issue.” When does “daylight savings” end?

title: Trump says boat strike kills six off Venezuela
shortDescription: Presdient Trump says U.S. military strike killed 6 'narcoterrorists' off Venezuela's coast in boat strike.

title: Trump reports 5th deadly strike on boat near Venezuela
shortDescription: President Donald Trump announced on October 14 that the U.S. military, for the fifth time in less than six weeks, carried out a deadly strike that morning on an alleged “narco-trafficking” vessel off the coast of Venezuela.

title: Trump threatens ban on cooking oil from China over soybean purchases
shortDescription: Soybeans were the number one U.S. agricultural export, worth about $24.5 billion and more than half of it was bought by China.

title: Charlie Kirk posthumously awarded Medal of Freedom at White House
shortDescription: President Trump awarded the Medal of Freedom, posthumously, to Charlie Kirk. The ceremony coincides with what would have been Kirk’s 32nd birthday.

title: TSA video blames Democrats for government shutdown
shortDescription: Some airports in the U.S. are refusing to air a new TSA video from the Trump administration blaming Democrats for the government shutdown.

title: 'You won't see me in a bathing suit': Trump jabs Biden at White House event
shortDescription: Trump joked that his body might not "be appreciated on the beach" during a White House meeting with Argentine President Javier Milei.

title: Arizona AG demands Mike Johnson swear in Adelita Grijalva
shortDescription: Arizona Attorney General Kris Mayes threatened House Speaker Mike Johnson with legal action if he didn’t swear in Dem Rep.-elect Adelita Grijalva.

title: Trump awards Charlie Kirk, slain political ally, Medal of Freedom
shortDescription: Trump presents Charlie Kirk's widow Erika with a posthumous Medal of Freedom honoring the slain conservative activist.

title: Trump says Hamas will disarm
shortDescription: President Donald Trump said Hamas will disarm voluntarily or face swift and possibly violent consequences.

title: Trump: Hamas will disarm or the US will force them 'perhaps violently'
shortDescription: Trump assured reporters that Hamas would disarm under his peace agreement or he would disarm them 'perhaps violently.'

title: Trump says 6 killed off Venezuela's coast in latest US boat strike
shortDescription: President Trump said his administration ordered its fifth military strike on a vessel carrying illegal narcotics off the coast of Venezuela.

title: Trump says Time magazine cover gave him no hair. See photo
shortDescription: President Donald Trump appeared on the cover of Time magazine. But he did not like how the picture came out, taking to Truth Social to criticize it.

title: Maine Democratic Gov. Janet Mills to run for US Senate
shortDescription: Maine Democratic Gov. Janet Mills announced that she will be running for U.S. Senate in an effort to unseat Republican Sen. Susan Collins.

title: When is the next government shutdown vote in the Senate? What to know
shortDescription: The Senate's meeting on Oct. 14 will be another attempt to approve legislation to fund the government, following seven previous unsuccessful tries.

title: Trump hosts 'favorite president,' a self-described 'anarcho-capitalist'
shortDescription: Argentina's leader Javier Milei is a self-described radical libertarian and 'anarcho-capitalist' who claims to seek political advice from his dogs.

title: 'Batten down the hatches'. White House warns more layoffs are coming
shortDescription: The White House said more mass layoffs of federal workers are coming, on top of the 4,000 fired last week, as the government shutdown continues.
